alert.note: Alert for Western Clay; Western Putnam (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 08 at 9:55PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Putnam and southwestern Clay Counties through 1030 PM EDT... At 954 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout over Melrose Landing, or near Melrose, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Interlachen, Melrose, Melrose Landing, Hollister, Lake Geneva, Florahome, Putnam Hall, Carraway and Mannville. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
